title: Rage Against The Machine - Bulls On Parade (Official HD Video)

facts.text: Bulls on Parade was recorded in 1996 at Rage's self-built 'The Boat' studio in LA – a floating barge turned rock fortress!
Tom Morello invented the 'kill switch' guitar effect here, mimicking machine guns without any pedals!
Zack de la Rocha wrote lyrics protesting US arms sales – 'weapons not food, not homes, not shoes' rips Raytheon!
Morello's rig: Marshall stacks plus a bee-flavored fuzz pedal for that killer 'bulls on parade' roar!
1996: Rage refused to play MTV's Video Music Awards over corporate censorship beef!
Video shot guerrilla-style at Capitol Records building – cops shut it down mid-riot scene!
Director Peter Christopherson (Throbbing Gristle) filmed Zack crowd-surfing real fans in a mosh pit frenzy!
Band spray-painted 'Rage' on a US tank – nod to their anti-military protest roots!
Peaked at #2 on Billboard Mainstream Rock – banned from some radio for 'incendiary' lyrics!
1996 era: Rage headlined Lollapalooza protesting Ticketmaster monopoly – pure rebel fury!
Morello's uncle was Mexican President Lázaro Cárdenas – family history fuels their revolutionary fire!
Video features burning dollar bills symbolizing corporate greed – shot in one wild night!
Song inspired Occupy Wall Street chants – 'bulls on parade' became anti-corporate battle cry!
De la Rocha's rap style draws from Public Enemy – fused with metal for rap-rock revolution!
Evil Empire album debuted #1, selling 250K first week – Rage's biggest commercial roar!
Video banned from MTV rotation for 'violent imagery' – irony for a protest anthem!
1996: Rage reunited with ex-drummer Bryan Mantia briefly before Brad Wilk locked in!
Morello tuned guitar to drop D for that seismic riff – standard for their wall-of-sound assault!
